qas.question: How many district courts does Oklahoma have?
How many counties does Oklahoma have?
What is the civil court of last resort in Oklahoma?
What is the criminal court of last resort in Oklahoma?

answers.text: the state Court of Criminal Appeals

qas.question: What is the only other state with two courts of last resort?

context: Oklahoma's judicial branch consists of the Oklahoma Supreme Court, the Oklahoma Court of Criminal Appeals, and <a0_0><a1_0>77<a1_0/><a0_0/> District Courts that each serves one county. The Oklahoma judiciary also contains two independent courts: a Court of Impeachment and the Oklahoma Court on the Judiciary. Oklahoma has two courts of last resort: <a2_0>the state Supreme Court<a2_0/> hears civil cases, and <a3_0>the state Court of Criminal Appeals<a3_0/> hears criminal cases (this split system exists only in Oklahoma and neighboring <a4_0>Texas<a4_0/>). Judges of those two courts, as well as the Court of Civil Appeals are appointed by the Governor upon the recommendation of the state Judicial Nominating Commission, and are subject to a non-partisan retention vote on a six-year rotating schedule.
